I have played Assault squad 1 for a whopping 1300 hours, and i am (was) a real fan of the assault squad series. I do realize this game is still in beta, and it runs really really bad on most computers, but i have not taken that into account, only the flaws in the game design and gameplay. This would have been a great game if they hadn't tried to make it like CoH3 or something.

It still has the unique Men of war feel, but the ranges man, the ranges.. so godawful... in addittion to everything else they messed up. Unit icons on the left are a really hard-to-see and confusing mess, the HUD generally is very very confusing and theres alot of unneeded stuff on your screen, what limits your field of view. I honestly don't see any improvements on the AI or the pathfinding (except that neat path that shows where they will go)

The tank Ranges used to be fun and challenging, except a maybe little too short, but now your tanks have no choice but to get into the frontline with your infantry and get bazooka'd. This might rise up the importance of infantry but for all the wrong reasons. In assault squad 1 you could easily take out a tank with infantry if you had any tactics and perhaps some stealth too.

The infantry seem to be really tough now, which is unrealistic and totally lame. There used to be a time when you had to crawl your men through the battlefield to not make them die from a Buzzsaw (mg42) but now you can just throw them out to the field with only minor damage to them by bullets. And infantry behind cover... I like the suppression thing they added... but the way infantry only takes cover when they are hit is silly, As an infantryman you take cover when you are being shot at and you get supressed, The current system is like you can keep an enemy infantryman behind cover as long as you hit him once every 5 seconds or so...

An absolute NO-buy recommendation in its current state.

Technical issues:

-Collosal load stutter ingame
-Connecting to a game lobby takes 20 or more seconds, if it actually gets through
-At least 5 different crashes both ingame and during loading related to missing models and textures
-Constant low fps (unless the game is paused)
-Complaining about these issues in the group chat got me banned from that chat.

EDIT:
-While the lesser bugs (crashes due to missing or wrong filenames) have been fixed, there is still no stable performance.

All of that on a rig that exceeds the minimum requirements by far (4x3600 CPU, GF465GTX 1GB, WIN7 64)


Even for a beta (5 weeks before release) this is a catastrophic mess. Considering the previous game in the MOW series released without any of these issues. And now the release date has been pushed back.

General Game issues:

The game is basically a graphics update with very little actual new gameplay features. 

The new interface changes are mostly superficial.
The 8v8 mode is not something new. The original Men of War (before MOWAS1) already had 16 player support and maps that supported it. Trying to sell this as a new feature is bad.


The only hard reasons to get the new MOWAS2 is the advertised multicore support, some higher texture resolutions and steam workshop support.
Now the issue is that they failed to provide the advertised multicore support during the last 6 weeks and seeing how they tripped over the 20 february release date and pushed it back I am skeptical about delivery in the next 5 weeks. 
The improved graphics (normal maps, higher texture resolutions for terrain) can not be counted as working because performance is so bad that players with high end rigs still have to turn down settings.


Digital Mindsoft also seriously lacks in profesionalism in the PR department. Players have been banned for days and weeks for pointing out flaws in new patches and negative reviews or comments are often attempted to be removed.


An absolute NO-buy recommendation in its current state.

If you havent played any of the Men of War games, and I would only really recommend Men of War, Men of War Assault Squad and to some extent Men of War Red Tide. Then do so now! Men of War is the successor to Soldiers Heroes of WW2 and Faces of War. In many respects the game remained unchanged for many years and then DMS took the reigns with the Assault Squad frnachise. Assault Squad largely focusses on MP and whilst there are Single Player skirmish, these again are recommended to be played in Co Op. There is no SP campaign like the MoW or Red Tide games.

So what about Assault Squad 2? Its in beta atm and so there are performance issues and bugs as to be expected. The major ground work on AS2 is the engine improvements, graphic updates, new models for many vehicles and tanks and lots of new MP maps and SP missions/skirmish.

The gameplay is largely the same as AS. The UI has more detailed information now. The UI does look a little bit cluttered for my liking but I am sure a mod will simplify this and it is still in beta so may change for release. 

AS2, no more Gamespy! yea! Easier installation and file sharing of mods. In game voice chat. Better options in MP. Having played the beta the SP Skirmish is similar to AS, but there arent waves of enemy attacks. It feels more structured and you get extra resources dependent on your actions. In all the SP side and Co OP looks promising and is a bit more creative than the skirmishes in AS. MP the new maps look and play well. Performance is impacting MP atm, but patches are being released every few days. 

Overall not a huge amount different to AS, although the improvements to the engine have upgraded to Multi Core CPU support and therefore the graphics are really looking top notch. The tank models are outstanding. New MP and SP maps should keep us MoW players happy for some time. The new UI gives more information including unit kills per unit. 

A complex game which just keeps getting better and better. If you compare AS2 to MoW MP the difference is huge. I wouldnt go back, however the SP portion of MoW is more captivating.

It's basically an engine rewrite (multicore, new graphics) of the first MoW:AS, with shiny new models, 2 new(ish) tanks, and new missions made by a great community modder DJSatane (Much love, much respect). I've heard of some gameplay changes but I haven't noticed them.

He says DLC support will be greater, and hopefully the final game will be more stable (it crashes extremely often now). Hopefully older content will be easily ported to this.

I'd get it only if you're a hardcore MoW fan, otherwise wait until after release. Still, Assault Squad was probably the best multiplayer experience in the series and an improved version of it is probably worth getting in my book (provided stability issues are solved)

The graphics do look very nice and there are several small details i appreciate like the ejecting shell and the smoke from the breech of the cannon and other small things that added to the whole. The gameplay is just as good as the first Assault Squad and ive played 3 matches so far and 2 of them had good frame rates and all while one was bad but hey 2:3 isnt to bad especially for pre-release. There is still the fun 3rd person mode and all the other things that make men of war the amazing RTS it is. I would certinly reccomend this game to any fan of the men of war series and really to anyone who enjoys RTS's or stratagy games in general.
